As the Autobots and Decepticons, Maximals and Predacons all flee the scene
=
of Hydras=92 base, the Black Tower, a deep rumble can be felt. It=92s small=
 at
first, but it quickly grows. The sound was like some sickening drum bea=
t
that was slowly getting louder and louder!



Explosions!



That what co=
uld be felt as the Black Tower itself began to smoke, and fire
began to ris=
e from its flank, black soot and flames peek out through holes
that erupt a=
long its length as the walls began to buckle from internal
pressures. For a=
 moment the walls themselves seem to almost glow as some
sort of strange en=
ergy ran along them, first tracing out the internal frame
of the wall itsel=
f and then extending outwards along the ground.



Silence!



For a moment=
 everything stopped, the rumbling halted and the glowing energy
seemed to a=
lmost fade. However at the same time the sounds of birds, great
crowds of t=
hem could be heard as they screeched in alarm and took to the
air. And then=
 there were the animals, at least the few that were left in the
burnt out l=
and that surrounded Hydras=92 base; all of them began to run as
fast as the=
ir bodies could carry them!



DETONATION!



For a moment it appeared as i=
f the sun itself had replaced Hydras=92 tower as
a ball of fire exploded ou=
t from the it, incinerating the instantly! Then
the fire itself reached out=
 like a tidal wave of destruction, rolling out
along the ground in all dire=
ctions, engulfing anything in its path! The
sound of its passing was like t=
hunder, a continuous booming that echoed
across the lands, the sound of it =
shattering the air and cracking stone.



AFTERMATH!



Finally the ball of=
 fire, like a true tidal wave began to recede, its power
spent in a flash a=
nd now beginning to ebb. The flames which burned white hot
a moment ago beg=
an to dim, leaving everything with the space of 10 miles a
burnt out wreck,=
 a charred remnant of what it had once been.



However it was not over.


=

Lava began to rumble deep beneath the spot that the tower had stood, it
be=
gan to boil and froth as the internal energies of the Earth, as if in
answe=
r to the explosion that had just taken place began to make itself
heard.


=

With an explosive push, superheated liquid rock burst forth from the groun=
d
like some grotesque fountain rising into the air. Stretching nearly 5 mil=
es
in diameter and pushing several hundred feet into the air a new Volcano =
was
born, one that would make itself heard and felt for a long time to come=
.


(END OF THREAD)

--90e6ba53a7a243ba58049c573a1f
